result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas D Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas D Harris

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Notice of Completion of Representation

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Thomas D Harris in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 20  days in the House of Correction, with 20 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 5/13/2020.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED non-madatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court on behalf of William Hotchkiss. Defendant Thomas D Harris not in court, in custody. Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests a sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Thomas D Harris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk of Court: MMS.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21. Defense Counsel requested earliest date to facilitate global resolution with Defendant's other case. The Court contacted Branch 21 to see if we could get a date prior to 4/18, and was told no earlier dates available. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited. 

Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.

Attorney Michael S. Holzman in court.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing Hearing.  DEFENDANT NOT PRESENT.  Defense indicates that the defendant appeared this morning but left shortly after discussions with defense counsel.

On state's motion, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their Motion to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis for the REVOCATION of the DPA.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Defense advised that he is seeking a Global Resolution.  Defense will be checking with Br. 38 to see if they will accept this matter.  Court is willing to allow this case to be transferred.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Michael S. Holzman in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Court CONTINUED to take that Motion under advisement at this time.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter before the Court for Scheduling.  Defendant has picked up a new Felony matter.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Court takes that motion under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT IS WILLING TO TRANSFER THIS CASE OR TO HAVE THE NEW MATTER TRANSFERRED HERE IF ALL PARTIES INCLUDING THE COURT AGREE.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16RM012848  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/26/2016

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No driving without a valid license. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Thomas D Harris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Defense reports that Defendant needs to speak with his PO regarding the 'Phase Forward' program.  Defendant has completed 4 (FOUR) of 12 (TWELVE) community service hours.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant attended all JP contacts and recently tested negative.  Defendant will begin Thinking for a Change.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
NO GUN OR DRUG ORDER, signed and filed.  lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Thomas D Harris in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Room 310 Safety Building on 05-11-2015 at 01:30pm
